<!-- WARNING: this file was generated by Pulumi Docs Generator. -->
<!-- Do not edit by hand unless you're certain you know what you are doing! -->

Generates a Core Network policy document in JSON format for use with resources that expect core network policy documents such as `awscc_networkmanager_core_network`. It follows the API definition from the [core-network-policy documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/cloudwan/cloudwan-policies-json.html).

Using this data source to generate policy documents is *optional*. It is also valid to use literal JSON strings in your configuration or to use the `file` interpolation function to read a raw JSON policy document from a file.


<div><pulumi-examples>

package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aws/sdk/v6/go/aws/networkmanager"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := networkmanager.GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocument(ctx, &networkmanager.GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentArgs{
			AttachmentPolicies: []networkmanager.GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentAttachmentPolicy{
				{
					Action: {
						AssociationMethod: "constant",
						Segment:           pulumi.StringRef("shared"),
					},
					ConditionLogic: pulumi.StringRef("or"),
					Conditions: []networkmanager.GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentAttachmentPolicyCondition{
						{
							Key:      pulumi.StringRef("segment"),
							Operator: pulumi.StringRef("equals"),
							Type:     "tag-value",
							Value:    pulumi.StringRef("shared"),
						},
					},
					RuleNumber: 100,
				},
				{
					Action: {
						AssociationMethod: "constant",
						Segment:           pulumi.StringRef("prod"),
					},
					ConditionLogic: pulumi.StringRef("or"),
					Conditions: []networkmanager.GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentAttachmentPolicyCondition{
						{
							Key:      pulumi.StringRef("segment"),
							Operator: pulumi.StringRef("equals"),
							Type:     "tag-value",
							Value:    pulumi.StringRef("prod"),
						},
					},
					RuleNumber: 200,
				},
			},
			CoreNetworkConfigurations: []networkmanager.GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentCoreNetworkConfiguration{
				{
					AsnRanges: []string{
						"64512-64555",
					},
					EdgeLocations: []networkmanager.GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentCoreNetworkConfigurationEdgeLocation{
						{
							Asn:      pulumi.StringRef("64512"),
							Location: "us-east-1",
						},
						{
							Asn:      pulumi.StringRef("64513"),
							Location: "eu-central-1",
						},
					},
					VpnEcmpSupport: pulumi.BoolRef(false),
				},
			},
			SegmentActions: []networkmanager.GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentSegmentAction{
				{
					Action:  "share",
					Mode:    pulumi.StringRef("attachment-route"),
					Segment: "shared",
					ShareWiths: []string{
						"*",

				},

			Segments: []networkmanager.GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentSegment{
				{

					RequireAttachmentAcceptance: pulumi.BoolRef(true),

```java
package generated_program;

import com.pulumi.Context;
import com.pulumi.Pulumi;
import com.pulumi.core.Output;
import com.pulumi.aws.networkmanager.NetworkmanagerFunctions;
import com.pulumi.aws.networkmanager.inputs.GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentArgs;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Map;
import java.io.File;
import java.nio.file.Files;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class App {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Pulumi.run(App::stack);
    }

    public static void stack(Context ctx) {
        final var test = NetworkmanagerFunctions.getCoreNetworkPolicyDocument(GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentArgs.builder()
            .attachmentPolicies(            
                GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentAttachmentPolicyArgs.builder()
                    .action(GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentAttachmentPolicyActionArgs.builder()
                        .associationMethod("constant")
                        .segment("shared")
                        .build())
                    .conditionLogic("or")
                    .conditions(GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentAttachmentPolicyConditionArgs.builder()
                        .key("segment")
                        .operator("equals")
                        .type("tag-value")
                        .value("shared")
                        .build())
                    .ruleNumber(100)
                    .build(),
                GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentAttachmentPolicyArgs.builder()
                    .action(GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentAttachmentPolicyActionArgs.builder()
                        .associationMethod("constant")
                        .segment("prod")
                        .build())
                    .conditionLogic("or")
                    .conditions(GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentAttachmentPolicyConditionArgs.builder()
                        .key("segment")
                        .operator("equals")
                        .type("tag-value")
                        .value("prod")
                        .build())
                    .ruleNumber(200)
                    .build())
            .coreNetworkConfigurations(GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentCoreNetworkConfigurationArgs.builder()
                .asnRanges("64512-64555")
                .edgeLocations(                
                    GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentCoreNetworkConfigurationEdgeLocationArgs.builder()
                        .asn(64512)
                        .location("us-east-1")
                        .build(),
                    GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentCoreNetworkConfigurationEdgeLocationArgs.builder()
                        .asn(64513)
                        .location("eu-central-1")
                        .build())
                .vpnEcmpSupport(false)
                .build())
            .segmentActions(GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentSegmentActionArgs.builder()
                .action("share")
                .mode("attachment-route")
                .segment("shared")
                .shareWiths("*")
                .build())
            .segments(            
                GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentSegmentArgs.builder()
                    .description("Segment for shared services")
                    .name("shared")
                    .requireAttachmentAcceptance(true)
                    .build(),
                GetCoreNetworkPolicyDocumentSegmentArgs.builder()
                    .description("Segment for prod services")
                    .name("prod")
                    .requireAttachmentAcceptance(true)
                    .build())
            .build());

    }
}
```

import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as aws from "@pulumi/aws";

const test = aws.networkmanager.getCoreNetworkPolicyDocument({
    attachmentPolicies: [
        {
            action: {
                associationMethod: "constant",
                segment: "shared",
            },
            conditionLogic: "or",
            conditions: [{
                key: "segment",
                operator: "equals",
                type: "tag-value",
                value: "shared",
            }],
            ruleNumber: 100,
        },
        {
            action: {
                associationMethod: "constant",
                segment: "prod",
            },
            conditionLogic: "or",
            conditions: [{
                key: "segment",
                operator: "equals",
                type: "tag-value",
                value: "prod",
            }],
            ruleNumber: 200,
        },
    ],
    coreNetworkConfigurations: [{
        asnRanges: ["64512-64555"],
        edgeLocations: [
            {
                asn: "64512",
                location: "us-east-1",
            },
            {
                asn: "64513",
                location: "eu-central-1",
            },
        ],
        vpnEcmpSupport: false,
    }],
    segmentActions: [{
        action: "share",
        mode: "attachment-route",
        segment: "shared",
        shareWiths: ["*"],
    }],
    segments: [
        {
            description: "Segment for shared services",
            name: "shared",
            requireAttachmentAcceptance: true,
        },
        {
            description: "Segment for prod services",
            name: "prod",
            requireAttachmentAcceptance: true,
        },
    ],
});

<span class="k">&nbsp;&nbsp;arguments:</span>
<span class="c">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;# arguments dictionary</span></code></pre></div>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>



The following arguments are supported:


<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="corenetworkconfigurations_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#corenetworkconfigurations_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Configurations</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#getcorenetworkpolicydocumentcorenetworkconfiguration">List&lt;Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Configuration&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The core network configuration section defines the Regions where a core network should operate. For AWS Regions that are defined in the policy, the core network creates a Core Network Edge where you can connect attachments. After it's created, each Core Network Edge is peered with every other defined Region and is configured with consistent segment and routing across all Regions. Regions cannot be removed until the associated attachments are deleted. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="segments_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#segments_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Segments</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#getcorenetworkpolicydocumentsegment">List&lt;Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Segment&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Block argument that defines the different segments in the network. Here you can provide descriptions, change defaults, and provide explicit Regional operational and route filters. The names defined for each segment are used in the <code>segment_actions</code> and <code>attachment_policies</code> section. Each segment is created, and operates, as a completely separated routing domain. By default, attachments can only communicate with other attachments in the same segment. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="attachmentpolicies_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#attachmentpolicies_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Attachment<wbr>Policies</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#getcorenetworkpolicydocumentattachmentpolicy">List&lt;Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Attachment<wbr>Policy&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>In a core network, all attachments use the block argument <code>attachment_policies</code> section to map an attachment to a segment. Instead of manually associating a segment to each attachment, attachments use tags, and then the tags are used to associate the attachment to the specified segment. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="segmentactions_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#segmentactions_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Segment<wbr>Actions</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#getcorenetworkpolicydocumentsegmentaction">List&lt;Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Segment<wbr>Action&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block argument, <code>segment_actions</code> define how routing works between segments. By default, attachments can only communicate with other attachments in the same segment. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="version_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#version_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Version</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd></dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

## Supporting Types


<h4 id="getcorenetworkpolicydocumentattachmentpolicy">Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Attachment<wbr>Policy</h4>



<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="action_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#action_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Action</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#getcorenetworkpolicydocumentattachmentpolicyaction">Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Attachment<wbr>Policy<wbr>Action</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Action to take when a condition is true. Detailed Below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="conditions_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#conditions_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Conditions</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#getcorenetworkpolicydocumentattachmentpolicycondition">List&lt;Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Attachment<wbr>Policy<wbr>Condition&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block argument. Detailed Below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="rulenumber_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#rulenumber_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Rule<wbr>Number</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>An integer from <code>1</code> to <code>65535</code> indicating the rule's order number. Rules are processed in order from the lowest numbered rule to the highest. Rules stop processing when a rule is matched. It's important to make sure that you number your rules in the exact order that you want them processed.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="conditionlogic_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#conditionlogic_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Condition<wbr>Logic</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Valid values include <code>and</code> or <code>or</code>. This is a mandatory parameter only if you have more than one condition. The <code>condition_logic</code> apply to all of the conditions for a rule, which also means nested conditions of <code>and</code> or <code>or</code> are not supported. Use <code>or</code> if you want to associate the attachment with the segment by either the segment name or attachment tag value, or by the chosen conditions. Use <code>and</code> if you want to associate the attachment with the segment by either the segment name or attachment tag value and by the chosen conditions. Detailed Below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="description_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#description_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Description</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A user-defined description that further helps identify the rule.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#getcorenetworkpolicydocumentattachmentpolicyaction">Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Attachment<wbr>Policy<wbr>Action</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Action to take when a condition is true. Detailed Below.</p>

            title="Required">
        <span id="conditions_java">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#getcorenetworkpolicydocumentattachmentpolicycondition">List&lt;Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Attachment<wbr>Policy<wbr>Condition&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block argument. Detailed Below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="rulenumber_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#rulenumber_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">rule<wbr>Number</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Integer</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>An integer from <code>1</code> to <code>65535</code> indicating the rule's order number. Rules are processed in order from the lowest numbered rule to the highest. Rules stop processing when a rule is matched. It's important to make sure that you number your rules in the exact order that you want them processed.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="conditionlogic_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#conditionlogic_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">condition<wbr>Logic</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Valid values include <code>and</code> or <code>or</code>. This is a mandatory parameter only if you have more than one condition. The <code>condition_logic</code> apply to all of the conditions for a rule, which also means nested conditions of <code>and</code> or <code>or</code> are not supported. Use <code>or</code> if you want to associate the attachment with the segment by either the segment name or attachment tag value, or by the chosen conditions. Use <code>and</code> if you want to associate the attachment with the segment by either the segment name or attachment tag value and by the chosen conditions. Detailed Below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A user-defined description that further helps identify the rule.</p>
</dd></dl>

<h4 id="getcorenetworkpolicydocumentattachmentpolicyaction">Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Attachment<wbr>Policy<wbr>Action</h4>



<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="associationmethod_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#associationmethod_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Association<wbr>Method</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Defines how a segment is mapped. Values can be <code>constant</code> or <code>tag</code>. <code>constant</code> statically defines the segment to associate the attachment to. <code>tag</code> uses the value of a tag to dynamically try to map to a segment.reference_policies_elements_condition_operators.html) to evaluate.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="requireacceptance_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#requireacceptance_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Require<wbr>Acceptance</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Determines if this mapping should override the segment value for <code>require_attachment_acceptance</code>. You can only set this to <code>true</code>, indicating that this setting applies only to segments that have <code>require_attachment_acceptance</code> set to <code>false</code>. If the segment already has the default <code>require_attachment_acceptance</code>, you can set this to inherit segment’s acceptance value.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="segment_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#segment_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Segment</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Name of the <code>segment</code> to share as defined in the <code>segments</code> section. This is used only when the <code>association_method</code> is <code>constant</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="tagvalueofkey_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#tagvalueofkey_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Tag<wbr>Value<wbr>Of<wbr>Key</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Maps the attachment to the value of a known key. This is used with the <code>association_method</code> is <code>tag</code>. For example a <code>tag</code> of <code>stage = “test”</code>, will map to a segment named <code>test</code>. The value must exactly match the name of a segment. This allows you to have many segments, but use only a single rule without having to define multiple nearly identical conditions. This prevents creating many similar conditions that all use the same keys to map to segments.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

        <span id="association_method_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#association_method_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">association_<wbr>method</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Defines how a segment is mapped. Values can be <code>constant</code> or <code>tag</code>. <code>constant</code> statically defines the segment to associate the attachment to. <code>tag</code> uses the value of a tag to dynamically try to map to a segment.reference_policies_elements_condition_operators.html) to evaluate.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="require_acceptance_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#require_acceptance_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">require_<wbr>acceptance</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Determines if this mapping should override the segment value for <code>require_attachment_acceptance</code>. You can only set this to <code>true</code>, indicating that this setting applies only to segments that have <code>require_attachment_acceptance</code> set to <code>false</code>. If the segment already has the default <code>require_attachment_acceptance</code>, you can set this to inherit segment’s acceptance value.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="segment_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#segment_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">segment</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Name of the <code>segment</code> to share as defined in the <code>segments</code> section. This is used only when the <code>association_method</code> is <code>constant</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="tag_value_of_key_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#tag_value_of_key_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">tag_<wbr>value_<wbr>of_<wbr>key</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Maps the attachment to the value of a known key. This is used with the <code>association_method</code> is <code>tag</code>. For example a <code>tag</code> of <code>stage = “test”</code>, will map to a segment named <code>test</code>. The value must exactly match the name of a segment. This allows you to have many segments, but use only a single rule without having to define multiple nearly identical conditions. This prevents creating many similar conditions that all use the same keys to map to segments.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<h4 id="getcorenetworkpolicydocumentcorenetworkconfiguration">Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Configuration</h4>



<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="asnranges_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#asnranges_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Asn<wbr>Ranges</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of strings containing Autonomous System Numbers (ASNs) to assign to Core Network Edges. By default, the core network automatically assigns an ASN for each Core Network Edge but you can optionally define the ASN in the edge-locations for each Region. The ASN uses an array of integer ranges only from <code>64512</code> to <code>65534</code> and <code>4200000000</code> to <code>4294967294</code> expressed as a string like <code>&quot;64512-65534&quot;</code>. No other ASN ranges can be used.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="edgelocations_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#edgelocations_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Edge<wbr>Locations</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#getcorenetworkpolicydocumentcorenetworkconfigurationedgelocation">List&lt;Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Edge<wbr>Location&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block value of AWS Region locations where you're creating Core Network Edges. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="insidecidrblocks_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#insidecidrblocks_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Inside<wbr>Cidr<wbr>Blocks</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block range used to create tunnels for AWS Transit Gateway Connect. The format is standard AWS CIDR range (for example, <code>10.0.1.0/24</code>). You can optionally define the inside CIDR in the Core Network Edges section per Region. The minimum is a <code>/24</code> for IPv4 or <code>/64</code> for IPv6. You can provide multiple <code>/24</code> subnets or a larger CIDR range. If you define a larger CIDR range, new Core Network Edges will be automatically assigned <code>/24</code> and <code>/64</code> subnets from the larger CIDR. an Inside CIDR block is required for attaching Connect attachments to a Core Network Edge.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="vpnecmpsupport_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#vpnecmpsupport_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Vpn<wbr>Ecmp<wbr>Support</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Indicates whether the core network forwards traffic over multiple equal-cost routes using VPN. The value can be either <code>true</code> or <code>false</code>. The default is <code>true</code>.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="go">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="asnranges_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#asnranges_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Asn<wbr>Ranges</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">[]string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of strings containing Autonomous System Numbers (ASNs) to assign to Core Network Edges. By default, the core network automatically assigns an ASN for each Core Network Edge but you can optionally define the ASN in the edge-locations for each Region. The ASN uses an array of integer ranges only from <code>64512</code> to <code>65534</code> and <code>4200000000</code> to <code>4294967294</code> expressed as a string like <code>&quot;64512-65534&quot;</code>. No other ASN ranges can be used.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="edgelocations_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#edgelocations_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Edge<wbr>Locations</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#getcorenetworkpolicydocumentcorenetworkconfigurationedgelocation">[]Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Edge<wbr>Location</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block value of AWS Region locations where you're creating Core Network Edges. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="insidecidrblocks_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#insidecidrblocks_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Inside<wbr>Cidr<wbr>Blocks</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">[]string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block range used to create tunnels for AWS Transit Gateway Connect. The format is standard AWS CIDR range (for example, <code>10.0.1.0/24</code>). You can optionally define the inside CIDR in the Core Network Edges section per Region. The minimum is a <code>/24</code> for IPv4 or <code>/64</code> for IPv6. You can provide multiple <code>/24</code> subnets or a larger CIDR range. If you define a larger CIDR range, new Core Network Edges will be automatically assigned <code>/24</code> and <code>/64</code> subnets from the larger CIDR. an Inside CIDR block is required for attaching Connect attachments to a Core Network Edge.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="vpnecmpsupport_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#vpnecmpsupport_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Vpn<wbr>Ecmp<wbr>Support</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Indicates whether the core network forwards traffic over multiple equal-cost routes using VPN. The value can be either <code>true</code> or <code>false</code>. The default is <code>true</code>.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="java">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="asnranges_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#asnranges_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">asn<wbr>Ranges</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;String&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of strings containing Autonomous System Numbers (ASNs) to assign to Core Network Edges. By default, the core network automatically assigns an ASN for each Core Network Edge but you can optionally define the ASN in the edge-locations for each Region. The ASN uses an array of integer ranges only from <code>64512</code> to <code>65534</code> and <code>4200000000</code> to <code>4294967294</code> expressed as a string like <code>&quot;64512-65534&quot;</code>. No other ASN ranges can be used.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="edgelocations_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#edgelocations_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">edge<wbr>Locations</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#getcorenetworkpolicydocumentcorenetworkconfigurationedgelocation">List&lt;Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Edge<wbr>Location&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A block value of AWS Region locations where you're creating Core Network Edges. Detailed below.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="insidecidrblocks_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#insidecidrblocks_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">inside<wbr>Cidr<wbr>Blocks</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;String&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block range used to create tunnels for AWS Transit Gateway Connect. The format is standard AWS CIDR range (for example, <code>10.0.1.0/24</code>). You can optionally define the inside CIDR in the Core Network Edges section per Region. The minimum is a <code>/24</code> for IPv4 or <code>/64</code> for IPv6. You can provide multiple <code>/24</code> subnets or a larger CIDR range. If you define a larger CIDR range, new Core Network Edges will be automatically assigned <code>/24</code> and <code>/64</code> subnets from the larger CIDR. an Inside CIDR block is required for attaching Connect attachments to a Core Network Edge.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="vpnecmpsupport_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#vpnecmpsupport_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">vpn<wbr>Ecmp<wbr>Support</a>

<h4 id="getcorenetworkpolicydocumentsegment">Get<wbr>Core<wbr>Network<wbr>Policy<wbr>Document<wbr>Segment</h4>



<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="name_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#name_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Unique name for a segment. The name is a string used in other parts of the policy document, as well as in the console for metrics and other reference points. Valid characters are a–z, and 0–9.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowfilters_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowfilters_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Allow<wbr>Filters</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of strings of segment names that explicitly allows only routes from the segments that are listed in the array. Use the <code>allow_filter</code> setting if a segment has a well-defined group of other segments that connectivity should be restricted to. It is applied after routes have been shared in <code>segment_actions</code>. If a segment is listed in <code>allow_filter</code>, attachments between the two segments will have routes if they are also shared in the segment-actions area. For example, you might have a segment named &quot;video-producer&quot; that should only ever share routes with a &quot;video-distributor&quot; segment, no matter how many other share statements are created.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="denyfilters_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#denyfilters_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Deny<wbr>Filters</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>An array of segments that disallows routes from the segments listed in the array. It is applied only after routes have been shared in <code>segment_actions</code>. If a segment is listed in the <code>deny_filter</code>, attachments between the two segments will never have routes shared across them. For example, you might have a &quot;financial&quot; payment segment that should never share routes with a &quot;development&quot; segment, regardless of how many other share statements are created. Adding the payments segment to the deny-filter parameter prevents any shared routes from being created with other segments.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="description_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#description_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Description</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A user-defined string describing the segment.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="edgelocations_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#edgelocations_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Edge<wbr>Locations</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A list of strings of AWS Region names. Allows you to define a more restrictive set of Regions for a segment. The edge location must be a subset of the locations that are defined for <code>edge_locations</code> in the <code>core_network_configuration</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="isolateattachments_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#isolateattachments_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Isolate<wbr>Attachments</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>This Boolean setting determines whether attachments on the same segment can communicate with each other. If set to <code>true</code>, the only routes available will be either shared routes through the share actions, which are attachments in other segments, or static routes. The default value is <code>false</code>. For example, you might have a segment dedicated to &quot;development&quot; that should never allow VPCs to talk to each other, even if they’re on the same segment. In this example, you would keep the default parameter of <code>false</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="requireattachmentacceptance_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#requireattachmentacceptance_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Require<wbr>Attachment<wbr>Acceptance</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>This Boolean setting determines whether attachment requests are automatically approved or require acceptance. The default is <code>true</code>, indicating that attachment requests require acceptance. For example, you might use this setting to allow a &quot;sandbox&quot; segment to allow any attachment request so that a core network or attachment administrator does not need to review and approve attachment requests. In this example, <code>require_attachment_acceptance</code> is set to <code>false</code>.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="yaml">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="name_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#name_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Unique name for a segment. The name is a string used in other parts of the policy document, as well as in the console for metrics and other reference points. Valid characters are a–z, and 0–9.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowfilters_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowfilters_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allow<wbr>Filters</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;String&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>List of strings of segment names that explicitly allows only routes from the segments that are listed in the array. Use the <code>allow_filter</code> setting if a segment has a well-defined group of other segments that connectivity should be restricted to. It is applied after routes have been shared in <code>segment_actions</code>. If a segment is listed in <code>allow_filter</code>, attachments between the two segments will have routes if they are also shared in the segment-actions area. For example, you might have a segment named &quot;video-producer&quot; that should only ever share routes with a &quot;video-distributor&quot; segment, no matter how many other share statements are created.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="denyfilters_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#denyfilters_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">deny<wbr>Filters</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;String&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>An array of segments that disallows routes from the segments listed in the array. It is applied only after routes have been shared in <code>segment_actions</code>. If a segment is listed in the <code>deny_filter</code>, attachments between the two segments will never have routes shared across them. For example, you might have a &quot;financial&quot; payment segment that should never share routes with a &quot;development&quot; segment, regardless of how many other share statements are created. Adding the payments segment to the deny-filter parameter prevents any shared routes from being created with other segments.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="description_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#description_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">description</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A user-defined string describing the segment.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="edgelocations_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#edgelocations_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">edge<wbr>Locations</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;String&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A list of strings of AWS Region names. Allows you to define a more restrictive set of Regions for a segment. The edge location must be a subset of the locations that are defined for <code>edge_locations</code> in the <code>core_network_configuration</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="isolateattachments_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#isolateattachments_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">isolate<wbr>Attachments</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>This Boolean setting determines whether attachments on the same segment can communicate with each other. If set to <code>true</code>, the only routes available will be either shared routes through the share actions, which are attachments in other segments, or static routes. The default value is <code>false</code>. For example, you might have a segment dedicated to &quot;development&quot; that should never allow VPCs to talk to each other, even if they’re on the same segment. In this example, you would keep the default parameter of <code>false</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="requireattachmentacceptance_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#requireattachmentacceptance_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">require<wbr>Attachment<wbr>Acceptance</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>This Boolean setting determines whether attachment requests are automatically approved or require acceptance. The default is <code>true</code>, indicating that attachment requests require acceptance. For example, you might use this setting to allow a &quot;sandbox&quot; segment to allow any attachment request so that a core network or attachment administrator does not need to review and approve attachment requests. In this example, <code>require_attachment_acceptance</code> is set to <code>false</code>.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

            title="Optional">

        <span id="mode_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#mode_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">mode</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>String. This mode places the attachment and return routes in each of the <code>share_with</code> segments. Valid values include: <code>attachment-route</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="share_with_excepts_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#share_with_excepts_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">share_<wbr>with_<wbr>excepts</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Sequence[str]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A set subtraction of segments to not share with.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="share_withs_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#share_withs_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">share_<wbr>withs</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Sequence[str]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A list of strings to share with. Must be a substring is all segments. Valid values include: <code>[&quot;*&quot;]</code> or <code>[&quot;&lt;segment-names&gt;&quot;]</code>.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
